intro: Claoxylon indicum f. angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed claoxylon, is a botanical variant of the claoxylon genus native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its distinctive, woody structure. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in lowland areas with high humidity. Due to its unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
